item.description:
Let's cool off with a good swim at Laurel Lake!

FYI, I think I'll get there around noon, give or take. I'll be doing the Mt. Grace Hike in the morning. Will probably stay until 2:30 or 3...it depends on the details of Alan's swing dancing (not to mention parking!) at Fitchburg Civic Days.

 

Cheryl's description:
Laurel Lake is located within the Erving State Forest. A $5 parking fee applies for each vehicle. Season passes available. Maybe still $35. Seniors (age 60 or 62)can get free season passes.

This is my favorite little lake. It's a private setting in the pines with very clear water.

The beach is open until 7pm, I think. Come enjoy anytime you can.

There is a vast picnic area with cooking capabilities if anyone chooses to cook food. Must bring your own charcoal, matches, etc.

Last year there was a food vendor available during the daytime but not sure if it still this year.

 

Park website: http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/central/ervf.htm

For directions: http://goo.gl/maps/CFM1

Erving State Forest

Laurel Lake Recreation Area

122 Long Pond Road

Warwick, MA 01378
978 544-3939

Campground(Seasonal)
978 544-7745

This forest provides a wide variety of recreational pursuits including, boating, swimming and fishing at Laurel Lake with its beautiful, brick-lined lakeshore, camping, picnicking, hunting, horseback riding and winter sports. The woodlands are interlaced by 8 miles of forest roads, and numerous trails lead to points of scenic interest.

Things to know before you go…
• Campground Office Hours: 9am–10pm
• Camping Season: late May through Labor Day weekend

DIRECTIONS

The forest is located in north central Massachusetts.

To Recreation Area & Campground:

From the East/Northeast/Southeast

Take I-495 to exit 29, Rt. 2 west.
Follow Rt. 2 west for 48 miles to exit 13, Rt. 2A east. (No “Exit 13” sign)
Drive 0.5 mile on Rt. 2A east and turn left onto Moss Brook Rd.
Drive 2 miles on Moss Brook Rd. and turn left onto Long Pond Rd.
Drive 0.5 mile on Long Pond Rd.
Park contact station is on the left.

OR

Take 1-90 (MA PIKE)west to exit 10 onto I-290 north.
Drive 7.3 miles on I-290 north to exit 19, I-190 north.
Drive 18.75 miles on I-190 north and merge onto Rt. 2 west.
Drive 36.5 miles on Rt. 2 west to exit 13, Rt. 2A east. (No “Exit 13” sign)
Drive 0.5 mile on Rt. 2A east and turn left onto Moss Brook Rd.
Drive 2 miles on Moss Brook Rd. and turn left onto Long Pond Rd.
Drive 0.5 mile on Long Pond Rd.
Park contact station is on left.

From the West

Take Rt. 2 east to Exit 13 onto Rt. 2A east. (No “Exit 13” sign)
Drive 0.5 mile on Rt. 2A east and turn left onto Moss Brook Rd.
Drive 2 miles on Moss Brook Rd. and turn left onto Long Pond Rd.
Drive 0.5 mile on Long Pond Rd.
Park contact station is on the left.

From the Northwest/Southwest

Take I-91 to Exit 27 onto Rt. 2 east.
Drive 14.4 miles on Rt. 2 east to exit 13 (Rt. 2A east). (No “Exit 13” sign)
Drive 0.5 mile on Rt. 2A east and turn left on Moss Brook Rd.
Drive 2 miles on Moss Brook Rd. and turn left on Long Pond Rd.
Drive 0.5 mile on Long Pond Rd.
Park Contact Station is on left.
